intro: Salsola baryosma, commonly known as Russian thistle or goatweed, is a flowering plant in the family Amaranthaceae. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, characterized by its succulent, spiny stems and small, greenish flowers. The plant is well adapted to harsh environments, with deep roots that allow it to survive in dry conditions. It produces small, dry fruits that contain seeds dispersed by wind, contributing to its invasive potential in some areas. Salsola baryosma is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and agricultural fields.
